result.execSummary:
The defendant Korea K Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
12/5/2017 - Court approves Substance Abuse Program for the defendant.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence defendant may be serving in another county.

miscConds.notes: Restitution due during term of probation. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-Counseling as deemed appropriate.
-Employment of at least 24 hours per week.
-Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: 7/17/2015 Court was informed of defendant's current medical condition along with proof from her doctor. The jail and DA have no objection to furlough. Court approves furlough for defendant from 7/17/2015 to 7/27/2015 at 6:00 pm due to her pregnancy. If defendant needs additional time to recover after 7/27/2015, she must inform the Court in writing and obtain approval.

Atty. DeJunco contacted the clerk to reschedule sentencing due to calendar conflict. Case rescheduled to 4/9/2015 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Korea K Beck in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire filed on both files, requesting to enter a plea to counts 3 & 4.  State moves to dismiss, but read-in all other counts; Court so grants.  State will be recommending a prison sentence, but not suggesting the length of time.  Defense is free to argue.  Court examines defendant.  Defendant changes plea to no contest.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Court orders presentence investigation and orders matter adj to 4/6 at 11 am for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
